name: Idiopathic Retroperitoneal Fibrosis with Ureteral Obstruction
chief_complaint: Severe flank pain and difficulty urinating
prognosis: Variable - depends on early intervention and response to immunosuppression. May progress to renal failure if untreated.
description: A rare inflammatory condition causing fibrotic tissue deposition in the retroperitoneum, often encasing and compressing the ureters. Etiology is unknown in idiopathic cases, though may be associated with IgG4-related disease. Leads to progressive hydronephrosis and renal impairment.
risk_factors: exposure to certain medications (ergot derivatives, beta-blockers)
multiple_choice: Idiopathic Retroperitoneal Fibrosis with Ureteral Obstruction
